"A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another." The Lord our Redeemer had not yet demonstrated fully that love to its completeness. After His condemnation in the judgment hall, His crucifixion on the cross, when He cried out in a clear, loud voice, "It is finished," that love stands forth as an exhibition of a new love--"as I have loved you"--is demonstrated. Can the human mind take this in? Can we obey the commandment given? 


                                      -191-
